item.name: CPU Fan Status
item.description: Synology cpu fan status Each meanings of status represented describe below. Normal(1): All CPU fans functional normally. Failed(2): One of CPU fan stopped.

item.name: DSM status
item.description:
This oid is for checking whether there is a latest DSM can be upgraded.
Available(1): There is version ready for download. Unavailable(2): The DSM is latest version. Connecting(3): Checking for the latest DSM. Disconnected(4): Failed to connect to server. Others(5): If DSM is upgrading or downloading, the status will show others."

item.name: Power Status
item.description:
"Synology power status Each meanings of status represented describe below.
Normal(1): All power supplies functional normally. Failed(2): One of power supply has failed. "

item.name: RAID Status
item.description:
Status:
Normal(1) - RAID is functioning normally
These statuses are shown when RAID is created or deleted: Repairing(2) Migrating(3) Expanding(4) Deleting(5) Creating(6) RaidSyncing(7) RaidParityChecking(8) RaidAssembling(9) Canceling(10)
Degrade(11) - Degrade is shown when a tolerable failure of disk(s) occurs
Crashed(12) - RAID has crashed and is now read-only
More at: http://download.synology.com/download/ds/userguide/Synology_DiskStation_MIB_Guide_enu_20110725.pdf

item.name: System Fan Status
item.description:
Synology system fan status Each meanings of status represented describe below.
Normal(1): All Internal fans functional normally. Failed(2): One of internal fan stopped. "

item.name: System Partition Status
item.description:
Synology system status Each meanings of status represented describe below.
Normal(1): System functionals normally. Failed(2): Volume has crashed.

item_prototype.name: Disk {#SNMPINDEX} Model
item_prototype.description: "Synology disk model name The disk model name will be showed here.

item_prototype.name: Disk {#SNMPINDEX} Status
item_prototype.description: Synology disk status Each meanings of status represented describe below. Normal(1): The hard disk functions normally. Initialized(2): The hard disk has system partition but no data. NotInitialized(3): The hard disk does not have system in system partition. SystemPartitionFailed(4): The system partitions on the hard disks are damaged. Crashed(5): The hard disk has damaged.

item_prototype.name: Disk {#SNMPINDEX} Temperature
item_prototype.description: Synology disk temperature The temperature of each disk uses Celsius degree.

item_prototype.name: Disk {#SNMPINDEX} Type
item_prototype.description: Synology disk type The type of disk will be showed here, including SATA, SSD and so on.

item_prototype.name: Network {#SNMPINDEX} In Octets
item_prototype.description: The total number of octets received on the interface

item_prototype.name: Network {#SNMPINDEX} Name
item_prototype.description: The textual name of the interface

item_prototype.name: Network {#SNMPINDEX} Out Octets
item_prototype.description: The total number of octets transmitted out of the interface

item_prototype.name: Volume {#SNMPINDEX} Description
item_prototype.description: A description of the type and instance of the storage described by this entry

item_prototype.name: Volume {#SNMPINDEX} Storage bytes read since last boot
item_prototype.description: The number of bytes read from this device since boot

item_prototype.name: Volume {#SNMPINDEX} Storage bytes Written since last boot
item_prototype.description: The number of bytes written to this device since boot

item_prototype.name: Volume {#SNMPINDEX} Storage Size
item_prototype.description: The size of the storage represented by this entry, in units of hrStorageAllocationUnits

item_prototype.name: Volume {#SNMPINDEX} Storage Size Used
item_prototype.description: The amount of the storage represented by this entry

trigger.name: DSM status - Checking for the latest DSM
DSM status - DSM is upgrading or downloading
DSM status - Failed to connect to server.
